alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:11AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Benton, northwestern Washington, Delaware, northeastern Mayes, northwestern Adair and northeastern Cherokee Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 411 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles south of Spavinaw State Park to 2 miles southwest of Noel. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Siloam Springs... Jay... Bella Vista... Lowell... Grove... Pea Ridge... Gentry... Tontitown... Gravette... Cave Springs... Decatur... West Siloam Springs... Langley... Colcord... Kansas... Adair... Highfill... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 74 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northwestern Arkansas...and northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
